Still an amazing game even after all these years.
Something about the pacing and the gameplay that has not been matched yet.
Mechanically, the game is very well balanced and gunplay is tons of fun.
In a narrative sense, the story is far from deep, but it is presented in a way that you feel part of the world, and that the people you interact with are more than mere objects to keep the action going.

An amazing game, and if you get tired, there are always tons of mods.

Totalmente recomendado, de esos juegos que nunca te aburres de jugar una y otra vez.

An amazing game that stands the test of time. It's dearly beloved among many for being not only revolutionary, but also a great game that stands on its own.

While it is deserving of praise for it's technological leaps and setting the standards for not only FPS, but the future of (PC) games in general, I think that many forget to review this game as-is.

Half-Life 2 is simply a fun game with great gameplay, a fantastic story backed by amazing voice acting, and has some of the best world building I've ever seen. I don't want to downplay the gameplay any, but the part of the game before you even pick up a gun is simply stunning. The visuals of the Citadel, the hatred for Breen, and overall just the feeling of City 17 sets the tone for the rest of the game. The gunplay is nothing to sneeze at, either. The enemies are well balanced, traversal across the world is varied with a few vehicles sprinkled throughout, and everything just feels great. You don't want to put the game down, but you also want to savor it. It's not really something you can play through just once. Each time you play though there's something a little different about how you play. There's no stealth mechanics or anything procedurally determined, but playing through a second time let's you observe things a little differently if you so choose. For instance, you can begin to piece the layout of the world together when you notice familiar landmarks or faces that you missed the first time.

Overall, there is lots to be said about the game, but I didn't really make it past the tip of the iceberg. It's just hands-down a great game in so many categories:

Revolutionary for it's time.
Still fun today.
Tons of mod support.
Shaped the PC gaming landscape.
Great story/world building.
Fun gameplay.
Phenomenal physics engine - even today.
Graphically holds up - even without mods.
The foundation for so many other games, such as Team Fortress 2, Portal, Garry's Mod, and more.

And so much more.

I had this game on Xbox in 2005 before I had a PC and played the crap out of it. Then I got it for PC and played the crap out of it again and again. This game has it all, deep story, puzzles, and fantastic physics!
I'm just writing this for the Steam Nominators Committee Badge. You already know how good this game is, so go play it if you haven't already. 10/10

Simply the best, most original and immersive FPS there ever was. Every now and then, I go back just to play through a specific favorite chapter, like "Water Hazard" or "Highway 17", and even "We Don't Go To Ravenholm" (but only in full daylight).
If you  haven't played it yet, you're missing out on a genre-defining classic.

Страный добрый Half-Life.
Играл её ещё в свои 12 лет.
Затягивает невероятно, сюжет хоть и длинный, но интересный.
Играть будет сложно и непревычно.
Что меня удивляет до сих пор, так это искусственный интелект, который жесть как проработан.
И даже играя на лёгком уровне сложности, вам всё равно придётся попотеть, чтобы пройти ту или иную локацию.
"Просыпайтесь, мистер Фриман". Каждый раз как в первый...
